text:
HPI:
   52F s/p ERCP ([**3-31**]), c/b pancreatitis and worsening C.diff colitis
   during previous admission ([**Date range (1) 7612**]); p/w abd pain found to have
   pancreatic pseudocyst s/p cyst gastrostomy ([**4-30**])
   .H/O pancreatic pseudocyst
   Assessment:
   POD 1.  Abdomen is soft and distended, NG to low cont. suction with
   billeous/ brownish drainage.  Bowel sounds absent.
   Action:
   -          OOB to chair,
   -          O2 weaned
   -          Started on PCA.
   -          Started on tpn.
   Response:
   alk phos down from 156- 149.
   450 cc output from NG, hypoactive bowel sounds heard.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor.
   Abdominal pain (including abdominal tenderness)
   Assessment:
   Patient complaining of 8 out of 10 pain this am in abdomen.
   Action:
   Started on dilaudid PCA,
   encouraged to use cough pillow during repositioning and coughing and
   deep breathing.
   Response:
   patient continues to complain of [**3-18**] out of 10 pain mostly with
   activity. However does state the PCA is helping with pain control.
   Plan:
   continue to monitor.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Patient extubated on face tent at 50% this am.  Lungs sound clear in
   upper airways however diminished at bases.  O2 sats 93-95%.  Patient
   states unable to breath properly due to abdominal pain.  Post
   extubation ABG- 7.49, 37, 75, 4, 29.
   Action:
   -          PCA started
   -          5 L NC added to 50% face tent
   -          Given cough pillow to assist with pain control during
   coughing and deep breathing.
   -          OOB to chair, Chest PT.
   -          Pm ABG taken.
   -          IS used.
   Response:
   patient continues on face tent and nasal  canula sating 96-98%
   ABG- 7.48,41,102,6,31,
   patient states it is easier for her to breath.
   Plan:
   continue to monitor
